location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘MAP INDICATING ROUGHLY AREAS SUBJECT TO CULTIVATION IN MESOPOTAMIA’

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: 1 paper folio produced by heliozincography [photozincography]Dimensions: 780 x 650mm

mods.abstract: The map provides information on land use for cultivation in Mesopotamia. The reference key indicates that land is divided into the following categories: rain lands, kurud (lift irrigation lands), irrigated corn lands, irrigated rice lands, and date gardens.The map was prepared for insertion into volume one of the report of the Mesopotamian Trade Commission (1917) of Holland and Wilson, which was prepared to inform the British Government's post war policy towards the region.The map was heliozincographed at the Survey of India Offices Calcutta.
